title: Bitcoin and ether fall as investors await this week's Fed rate decision: CNBC Crypto World
text: On today's episode of CNBC Crypto World, bitcoin and ether fall ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision on rates. Plus, Kraken's Thomas Perfumo breaks down the crypto exchange's new OTC report and what we can expect for major cryptocurrencies in the months to come.

title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says it's 'not the end of the world' if Trump's snapback tariffs go into effect on Friday
text: President Donald Trump says he won't budge on Friday's tariff deadline. His Treasury secretary said businesses shouldn't be concerned if the delayed tariffs go into effect.

title: No Room for "Hiccups:" Markets Priced to Perfection, FOMC Balancing Act Ahead
text: @CharlesSchwab's Nathan Peterson sees the trading action over the last two sessions as interesting. He believes they add to a thesis that markets are priced to perfection.

title: IMF raises 2025 growth forecast and warns against global trade tensions
text: The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday raised its global growth forecasts for 2025 and 2026 slightly, citing stronger-than-expected purchases ahead of an August 1 jump in U.S. tariffs and a drop in the effective U.S. tariff rate to 17.3% from 24.4%.

title: Bessent to American businesses: 'Not the end of the world' if April 2 tariffs kick in Friday
text: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent talks to CNBC's Eamon Javers on what U.S. companies can expect on August 1 tariff deadline.

title: Adam Parker: Not a single call from institutional investors on trade this week
text: Trivariate's Adam Parker joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss Parker's fixation on the trade negotiations, if markets are desensitized to trade risk and much more.

title: Trade Deals And Earnings Season Help Fuel Market Highs
text: The US struck trade deals with the Philippines, Indonesia, Japan, and the European Union with terms that were largely better than expected. Second-quarter earnings season is underway, and the signs are generally supportive of the equity market's resilience.

title: Why You Should Buy The AI Bubble
text: AI may be approaching a mania stage similar to the late-90s internet bubble, presenting both high-risk and high reward opportunities. I currently advocate participating in AI, but with full awareness it is probably entering the bubble stage.

title: Consumer Confidence Improves, but Job Prospect Concerns Remain
text: Consumer confidence reflected a cautiously improving outlook in July, according to The Conference Board. While there was some weakness in the labor market, consumers are starting to feel incrementally better about what lies ahead, according to a Tuesday (July 29) press release.

title: 5 Undervalued Dividend Stocks To Buy As Rally Gets Overextended
text: If you're thinking markets look a little tired lately, you aren't alone. The S&P 500 continues to set new highs on a weekly basis, and companies are still reporting strong earnings.

title: Bessent: China 'jumped the gun' on tariff pause announcement, still pending Trump's approval
text: A potential extension of a tariff pause between the United States and China is "pending President Trump's approval," Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Tuesday. "He'll have the final decision.

title: Steve Sosnick: 'Buckle up' if markets don't get best-case scenario on trade
text: Steve Sosnick, Interactive Brokers chief strategist, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss how much trade talks matter to equity markets, if the market is pricing in the best-case scenario on trade and much more.

title: Bessent says China talks 'robust,' did not include TikTok
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday said U.S.-China trade talks were "far reaching, robust and highly satisfactory," but the future of the short video app TikTok as well as the movement of Taiwan officials did not come up.

title: Brazil is planning relief measures for firms hit by US tariffs, says minister
text: Brazil is planning relief measures for companies impacted heavily by steeper U.S. tariffs set to take effect in August, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said on Tuesday.

title: The Fed is unlikely to cut rates, but this week's meeting is packed with intrigue
text: When the Fed releases its interest rate decision Wednesday, the narrative is almost certain to look a lot like June, with little changed in the statement and officials again holding off on any cuts. However, several fascinating subplots will be in play.

title: Echoes Of Exuberance: A Data-Driven Comparison Of The Dotcom And AI Market Eras
text: AI-driven market exuberance echoes the dot-com bubble, but today's hype is less extreme and more concentrated among a few tech giants. Valuations are historically high, with market cap-to-GDP ratios at unprecedented levels, yet current P/E ratios are less frothy than in 2000.

title: Trump's pharmaceutical tariffs could affect some drugmakers more than others
text: President Donald Trump is slated to impose tariffs on pharmaceuticals imported into the U.S. any day now – and they may have a bigger impact on some drugmakers than others. AbbVie, Bristol Myers Squibb and Eli Lilly appear "relatively well-positioned" based on their manufacturing footprint in the U.S. compared to abroad, while Novartis and Roche look more at risk, TD Cowen analyst Steve Scala said in a note.

title: Treasury Sec. Scott Bessent: 'Not end of the world' if snapback tariffs are on for days or weeks
text: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss the trade deals signed with the European Union, confirmation of the Vietnam deal and much more.

title: Treasury Sec. Scott Bessent: Wouldn't be surprised if EU put on some tariffs against China
text: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss the possibility of Trump and Xi Jinping meeting, Chinese purchases of Iranian oil and much more.

title: U.S.-China tariff pause extension not final until Trump signs off, trade negotiators say
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Greer hold a press conference on trade talks.
